resources.string: You're welcome to Weaver's Fen, traveler, but I would strongly suggest you stay in the settlement.\n\nPeople are getting a mysterious sickness from something out there.
Welcome, traveler. If you're looking for safe harbor from Corruption, this may be the wrong place.\n\nPeople are contracting a mysterious sickness, and we still don't know how to treat it.
Alchemist Rubis believes there is some merit to my theory, and she had some ideas of her own.\n\nShe reminded me that some among the Ancient Guardians seem have been dedicated healers.
The entire settlement is in your debt. These herbs and healing kits may not cure the illness, but they help.\n\nI think Constable Kemal might even pull through.
The herbs and the healing kits you recovered have certainly made a difference.\n\nWe don't have any new cases either, but many are still sick, and we still don't have a cure.
I think we're finally turning the corner with this mysterious illness. \n\nStill not sure where it came from, but Alchemist Rubis says the Spriggan Spores are going to work as a cure.
I'm always happy to spend time getting to know someone new, but I'm not feeling too well right now.\n\nPerhaps come back a little later.
I'm afraid you've picked a terrible time to visit. Several villagers have been ill, and some have gone mad and become Lost.\n\nMy own son was among them… and now I'm not feeling well, either.
I'm just trying to think, maybe it's a combination of factors causing the illness.\n\nOr maybe it's something from all the damn Ancient ruins in the swamp. My son often explored those ruins.
I have to admit, I am feeling a little bit better… as much as I have expected and even welcomed death.\n\nI won't give in, but if I am to live, I will want to remember my son… at his best.
Alchemist Rubis says I am not cured, but the illness no longer spreads inside me.\n\nThank you for the help you've given all of us, and to me personally.
There's not much work going on at the forges these days.\n\nHalf the village is sick, and the other half seems to be making plans to leave.

With the Shattered Mountain erupting and this strange illness, it's hard to blame people for their behavior.\n\nBut thievery? People here used to have integrity - this is the kind of thing that happens in Cutlass Keys!
I'm still doing inventory trying to identify all the things that were taken.\n\nThe food and supplies can ultimately be replaced, but the tools… those will be harder to come by out here.
Well now, that's a comforting sound isn't it? The smelters heating up, the sound of clanging on the anvil.\n\nI think we're going to pull through this.
With Falmea's Wrath in your hand, I'm sure you’re a spectacle to behold.\n\nA magician without equal, they'll say! I hope you enjoy it. I'm quite proud of the design.
There is a dark energy hanging over the Fen, do you feel it?\n\nI can't put my finger on it exactly, but I don't think it has anything to do with Corruption.

In all the hustle, the fear surrounding the illness that's plaguing the village, we've forgotten who we are.\n\nWe used to care for the Fen itself, its creatures, and even the people living out there.

I wonder when Hazel actually turned… do you think she came down with the illness as well?\n\nSomehow, I doubt that. The Fen loved her as much as I did - if anything, it's probably sad, or even… angry.
I suppose it's just a matter of time before someone starts calling me the old wise-woman of the Fen.\n\nI can handle that, but I'm not sure about communing with the Lost.
Some folks are saying that a warm cup of mead is the perfect way to stave off the illness.\n\nI heartily recommend you take precautions.
I never would have guessed so many of the residents of this town were such cowards.\n\nA couple of them robbed me blind and then fled. Irony is, they never made it out of the territory.
If I'm being honest, I was actually thinking of abandoning this place myself until you came along.\n\nNow, once this illness thing is past, I can get back out there and do some hunting.
You shall refer to me as Mistress Bergeron. \n\nI hope you like it as much as I do.
Stand upright and look me in the eye when you address me, Marauder. \n\nNow what is your business?

Stand upright and look me in the eye when you address me, Marauder. 

Now what is your business?

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Turn around, weak one, and return the direction from which you approached.
I am here on official business. I have no time to trifle with you.
Greetings, Gladiator {playerName}. I understand you continue on your path to glory.\n\nAre you now prepared to face the trial to become a Ravager?

Greetings, Gladiator {playerName}. I understand you continue on your path to glory.

Are you now prepared to face the trial to become a Ravager?

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Hail, fellow warrior! Your presence honors us here in the Fen.\n\nCome, let's not allow your talents to go to waste!

Hail, fellow warrior! Your presence honors us here in the Fen.

Come, let's not allow your talents to go to waste!

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Why continue to wander alone when the Syndicate offers so much?
Ah, excuse me, I was lost in thought. How might the Syndicate serve you?
Ah, excuse me, I was lost in thought. How might the Syndicate serve you?\n\n[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
You may be surprised to know that la famille Rubis has a lineage of great warriors.
To be free to practice the religion of your conscience without persecution. It was different back en France.
Some find the smell of the swamp offensive, but I find it quite delightful!\n\nAh, but it's you, Scrivener {playerName}! And you are prepared to advance in rank as well?

Some find the smell of the swamp offensive, but I find it quite delightful!

Ah, but it's you, Scrivener {playerName}! And you are prepared to advance In rank as well?

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
The specimens you gathered are helping me learn a great deal about the Fen.\n\nNow, what else can we do to benefit the Syndicate?

The specimens you gathered are helping me learn a great deal about the Fen.

Now, what else can we do to benefit the Syndicate?

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Those who are truly blind cannot see even in the light.
If you always give, you will always have. What may I give you, devotee?
If you always give, you will always have. What may I give you, devotee?\n\n[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Arrogance invites ruin. Humility receives benefits.
The bird does not sing because he has the answer. He sings because he has a song.
The Spark shines brightly in the Fen with you here, Templar {playerName}.\n\nAnd it seems you have now proven yourself worthy of further advancement.

The Spark shines brightly in the Fen with you here, Templar {playerName}.

And it seems you have now proven yourself worthy of further advancement.

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
You are always welcome to fight for justice with us here in Weaver's Fen.\n\nWherever you go, however, may the light of the Spark go with you.

You are always welcome to fight for justice with us here in Weaver's Fen.

Wherever you go, however, may the light of the Spark go with you.

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Takes a certain kind to travel through the Fen. You best be warned I'll have my eye on you, stranger.\n\nNo matter, make yourself comfortable. Just not too comfortable.
I was skeptical whe I first saw you stroll by here - but you've proven me wrong.\n\nWeaver's Fen's in a better place than when you found it. Have you heard about Restless Shore though?
Always good to see a familiar face back here in the Fen.\n\nPeople are still talking about all you did here.
Peace and good day, I am Master Fisher Agarwal. I know this Fen's fish better than anyone.
Peace and good day, I am Master Fisher Agarwal. I know this Fen's fish better than anyone.
Fish all you like in Aeternum, for the rivers and seas will never run barren!
Alright, Torchy, stay cool. Everything is going to be fine. \n\nOh… could you come back a bit later?
Well met, traveler! People call me Torchy, on account of my… interests.\n\nYou have my word, however. Despite what they say, I swear, I am not a threat to society.
You seem to be a bright light yourself, my friend. These torches cannot have been easy to acquire.\n\nI wonder, though, if you might humor Torchy for one more favor, eh?

Yes, my friend. With what you acquired, ETERNAL FLAME is finally within our reach!\n\nI just need to get back to my hovel in Restless Shore. So, maybe one more favor for Torchy? This time, it is a righteous one!
Once I am back in Restless Shore, I will create the world's first ETERNAL FLAME!\n\nI will light it in your honor, my friend. We will set the world on FIRE!
Hey, mind you don’t make too much noise, even on the road. \n\nYou never know what might come running out of the murk.
It’s quiet out there. Far too quiet.\n\nI fear the worst for my companions. They should have arisen by now. Have you perchance seen anyone in attire like mine along the road?

If you bested the Ravager, then perhaps you can help me. You see, the four of us always pick a meeting point in the event our hunts are unsuccessful. That none have arrived leads me to some… dark conclusions.
Well, this is grim, isn’t it? Am I the only one left?\n\nNo. Ruiz would not leave me like this. He must have…
I will remain vigilant. I cannot lose faith, nor hope, despite the fact that I must now hunt alone.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Greetings, denizen of this fine fetid land. Tis I! Samuel Worthington Bloodgood the Third, hunter extraordinaire, at your service!

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Oh, you must be the hardy sort, to wander so freely in a place like this! I dare say you might even be capable with that weapon of yours. \n\nWhat say you to a friendly competition?

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: It would be so terribly unfair of me to deprive you of another contest, since I so RUDELY abandoned my own attempt. \n\nShall we have another?

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: I am becoming increasingly eager to prove myself to you, my friend. To know you have toiled so hard in these blighted lands, and myself empty-handed! Why, it is hardly befitting of a Bloodgood, let alone the third.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: I understand I am stretching the bounds of your credulity right now. Truly, I do. \n\nUh, yes, I, uh, I have… a confession to make, if you will hear it.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Well, I believe retirement is in my future. A quiet, obscure, shameless retirement where no one need witness my forebear’s disappointment. \n\nI should thank you, but I would rather we did not meet again.
Just look at this incredible stonework! Can't you just feel the weight of the years, pressing down?

Oh, hello! Perfect timing! I'm Na Li, the architect. You've probably seen my work in the Ebonscale settlement.\n\nSay, do me a favor. Take a look at this bridge, and tell me: how old do you think it is?

Well, this is puzzling. Judging by the level of erosion, sediment layers, and my chemical analysis… these stones could be several orders of magnitude older than I first guessed. It defies the imagination.
I will not allow myself to grow too excited just yet. But if my observations are correct, this stone is many hundreds of thousands, perhaps even MILLIONS of years old. Think of the implications!
The future is bright, and I am going to be the one to build it.
The stench of this swamp…it's so beautiful.
Stop for a moment, friend. Take a deep breath. Yes, drink it in. What does the Fen smell like to you?
You can close your eyes against sight, plug your ears against sound… but you can't escape the smell, no.
If you happen to spot a woman hiding in some absurd corner of a ruin, do let her know she has won and the game is over. Thank you!

Finally, a traveler along the road!\n\nI’m Dr. Leonie Roggeveen. My wife Nora and I – we work as a team – we’re here to see what we could dig up in these ruins. To study. We’re antiquarians– numismatists– scholars, you see.
Hmm, yeah, that blue-ish hue means starmetal… and the three-faced queen on the obverse…there’s no doubt about it. This coin came from the Canopus dig site! \n\nBut wait! Huh, that’s strange…
Ahem! Okay, let’s see what we’ve got here. Hmm… If I turn it this way and hold it against the other coin… Some sort of bridge? Nein… An aquedu-- Aha! n\nI’ve got it! It came from Aqua Acadia!
Have you found any more clues? Or, uh, my wife?
That was fun. In hindsight, the added threat of bodily harm did make it more thrilling. I am just glad she is back with me.
Shh! Find your own hiding spot, will you?
She must be so worried about me…
I knew Leonie wouldn't be able to resist another puzzle. Be honest, she's loving this, right? She’s not too worried?
I think our next game will feature less… excitement. Ah, well, lesson learned.
I think our next game will feature less… excitement. Ah, well, lesson learned.
My, my, who's this? A hero? A legend?! Come to visit my humble little Medleyfaire? \n\nI'm charmed, honored, truly delighted to meet you!
My, my, who's this? A hero? A legend? Come to visit my humble Summer Medleyfaire? \n\nI'm charmed, honored, truly delighted to meet you!
Now, I speak of no humdrum fish. The Aeternum Sturgeon is the fairest creature in the sea, and fortune favors any who catch one. \n\nBut first, you'll need a fat, adorable little Maudlinbug for bait.
I must warn you; the Aeternum Sturgeon may be the finest fish you've ever caught, but they can be a bit challenging. \n\nAnd of course, you won't be the only angler seeking to land a prize.
Hmm… something's still amiss. And the sorry state of the dance floor won't do at all! \n\nOh, what to do, whom to invite?
Next, we'll need a splash of color. No such thing as too many flowers, and I know just the person. \n\nBak Ye-Jun. She's new to the island, so she may not have heard of our little party yet.
If you don’t mind meeting someone new, I have an old friend who always worries me this time of year. \n\nAll furrowed brows and thunderclouds, that one.
Now that we have honey, we need a baker who knows what to do with it. \n\nMischa Balchunas and her sweet, summery pastries… my mouth waters just thinking about it!
If you'll indulge me, my dear friend, I have one final guest on my mind. \n\nHave you ever read any verse by Blaise Thomas? Others may demur, but I consider him the poet laureate of Aeternum!
The dance floor is bursting, the food and drink are flowing, and the music never stops! \n\nI daresay, this is the finest Medleyfaire I've ever hosted, and I owe so much of it to you.
Welcome one, welcome all, to the Summer Medleyfaire! \n\nThis year is a complete triumph, thanks to you!
Food and drinks, get your food and drinks! \n\nDon't be shy, this banquet won't eat itself!
Kebabs, caviar, and that weird shimmering drink Claudia concocted! \n\nIt's all here, and all fresh!
Keep on dancing, yeah, keep on dancing! \n\nWe'll keep on playing, all night long!
Everybody having fun? \n\nDo I need to play LOUDER?
This is so much better than stuffy court music. Hah!

Wondering how to mount a fish? Don't worry, it gets easier and less smelly every year. \n\nJust bring your catch, and a special Ether Concoction to help preserve it. You can buy the ether with Summer Tokens.
Okay! We have seeds to plant, pots to water, stems to trim, vases to clean… \n\nIt never seems to end!
Okay! We have seeds to plant, pots to water, stems to trim, vases to clean… \n\nIt never seems to end!
These flowers are looking like they'll be able to sit for awhile without me, so… Yes! I shall attend the Medleyfaire!
The island is so alive here! What a joy! \n\nThank you friend, for allowing me to attend!
Oh! Pardon me, I didn't see you waiting. Do you… are you interested in a cake? Or a fruit tart?\n\nIf not, t-that's all right.
Oh! Pardon me, I didn't see you waiting. Do you… are you interested in a cake? Or a fruit tart?\n\nIf not, t-that's all right.
I sincerely hope my dance skills are up to par for the Medleyfaire Maestro.\n\nSee you at the Medleyfaire!
Am I doing it right? The dancing? \n\nI-I hope I'm not making a fool of myself.

Ah, let me guess. It's that time of year, the Master of Ceremonies "forgot" to find a proper carpenter, and they sent you to sweet-talk me. \n\nOh, don't look so surprised. It's the same story every year.

Ah, let me guess. It's that time of year, the Master of Ceremonies "forgot" to find a proper carpenter, and they sent you to sweet-talk me. \n\nOh, don't look so surprised. It's the same story every year.
You attached those vices like a true professional.\n\nI'll see you at the Medleyfaire!
Well, the stage doesn't look like it will collapse, and the Medleyfaire Maestro has invited me to dance. \n\nSo, dance I shall!
Oh, the despair! Fresh heartbreak, how it stings! \n\nThe clouds have swallowed the light of the stars, and never again shall they shine on this poor soul!
Oh, the despair! Fresh heartbreak, how it stings! \n\nThe clouds have swallowed the light of the stars, and never again shall they shine on this poor soul!
I have never seen such grace, such beauty! I am moved to tears, and I simply must see more of your dancing once I get to the Medleyfaire.
Jubilation and greetings, my inspiring friend! \n\nCome, come, come! Dance for me once more so I might be inspired anew!
Shoo, begone, you foul buzzing demons! \n\nOh no, I'm so sorry, I didn't mean you. Now I've gone and insulted a perfect stranger…
Shoo, begone, you foul buzzing demons! \n\nOh no, I'm so sorry, I didn't mean you. Now I've gone and insulted a perfect stranger…
Thankfully, the Maudlinbugs tend to be out in the wilds while I get to enjoy the shelter of the Medleyfaire.\n\nI shall buy you a drink once we're there!
I don't know… do you think the bees are doing well in my absence? \n\nI think it would be all right if I stayed for one more dance. Okay, let's go!
